section.para: &SERVICELong; integrates with &RAMlong; (&RAM;) to enable resource sharing. &RAM; is a service that enables you to share some &SERVICE; resources with other &AWS-accounts; or through &AOlong;. With &RAM;, you share resources that you own by creating a resource share. A resource share specifies the resources to share, and the consumers with whom to share them. Consumers can include:

listitem.para: Specific &AWS-accounts; inside or outside of its organization in &AOlong;
An organizational unit inside its organization in &AOlong;

section.para: For more information about &RAM;, see the &link-ram-ug;.
This topic explains how to share resources that you own, and how to use resources that are shared with you.

listitem.para: To share a &RESOURCE;, you must own it in your &AWS-account;. This means that the resource must be allocated or provisioned in your account. You cannot share a &RESOURCE; that has been shared with you.

To share a &RESOURCE; with your organization or an organizational unit in &AOlong;, you must enable sharing with &AOlong;. For more information, see Enable Sharing with &AOlong; in the &guide-ram-ug;.

section.para: To ensure that resources are distributed across the Availability Zones for a Region, we independently map Availability Zones to names for each account. This could lead to Availability Zone naming differences across accounts. For example, the Availability Zone us-east-1a for your &AWS-account; might not have the same location as us-east-1a for another &AWS-account;.

To identify the location of your &RESOURCE; relative to your accounts, you must use the Availability Zone ID (AZ ID). The AZ ID is a unique and consistent identifier for an Availability Zone across all &AWS-accounts;. For example, use1-az1 is an AZ ID for the us-east-1 Region and it is the same location in every &AWS-account;.
For more information about viewing the AZ IDs for the Availability Zones in your account, see AZ IDs for your &AWS; resources in the &guide-ram-ug;.

To share a &RESOURCE;, you must add it to a resource share. A resource share is an &RAM; resource that lets you share your resources across &AWS-accounts;. A resource share specifies the resources to share, and the consumers with whom they are shared. When you share a &RESOURCE; using the &SERVICE; console, you add it to an existing resource share. To add the &RESOURCE; to a new resource share, you must first create the resource share using the &RAM; console.

If you are part of an organization in &AOlong; and sharing within your organization is enabled, consumers in your organization are automatically granted access to the shared &RESOURCE;. Otherwise, consumers receive an invitation to join the resource share and are granted access to the shared &RESOURCE; after accepting the invitation.
You can share a &RESOURCE; that you own using the &SERVICE; console, &RAM; console, or the &CLI;.
